main.name: Keeton Martin
main.description: I am a software engineer and I've put together this page to showcase my work. Welcome to my home base on the internet
main.bio: I graduated from Haverford College with a B.S. in Computer Science in May 2022. I took a job at Salesforce as an engineer, and I started in August 2022. I like to build things in Python, Java, Javascript/Typescript, and in my free time I like to play and think about basketball, fiddle with keyboards, and enjoy the great outdoors. I've been traveling a lot lately, you can mostly find me in San Francisco or New York City.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to reach out to me using this form and I'll get back to you ASAP.

resume.skillmessage: Some of my skills with a somewhat arbitrary graphic representation of my competence.

education.degree: Bachelor's of Science in Computer Science
education.description: Studied Software Engineering, Algorithms, Data Structures, AI, Databases, and more. Minored in Statistics and minored in Neuroscience.
Graduated high school having focused on computer science and statistics.

work.title: Software Engineer (MTS)
work.description: As a software engineer in Automation Services, designed, developed, and tested new features and enhancements for Flow with scrum team using Typescript and Java. Led planning and execution of high impact epics on a greenfield data transformation ETL project. Promoted to mid-level engineer in February 2024.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Worked in the Salesforce core on a describe utility that generates OpenAPI definitions (interfaces for RESTful APIs) for DataRaptors - an essential clicks not code tool in the Salesforce Industries stack. Independent development work on enterprise software completed with guidance of a Senior Architect and Project Manager.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Developed and published a Node.js + Typescript command line tool using the Open CLI Framework (OCLIF) to create a Salesforce DX Plugin for a previously existing NPM Library including automated upload through Jenkins to npmjs.org. Development work done independently from scratch with guidance of a Senior Engineer.

projects.title: Routerunner
projects.category: A react web app to recommend credit cards based on a user's most frequest flight route

projects.title: Gametime Fantasy Dashboard
projects.category: A Dashboard for Sleeper Fantasy Football Leagues

projects.title: Thar She Blows
projects.category: A very simple DaisyUI web app to check the timing of transit routes I care about In San Francisco

projects.title: Olomi Afghan Artist
projects.category: An artist's website that I helped to build when he needed to br promoted for an auction fundraiser for a nonprofit

projects.title: My Corne Keyboard Layout
projects.category: I'm very interested in small ergonomic keyboards, this is the repo for my latest layout
